University Name: National and Kapodistrian University of Athens

Minimum GPA (or average): A specific minimum GPA is not officially published for all programs. For some postgraduate programs, a minimum GPA of 6.5/10 (Greek grading system) is a prerequisite. A strong academic record is essential for competitive programs like medicine.
Minimum SAT score (or average): SAT scores are an alternative to Greek entrance exams for the English-taught medical program. GMAT/GRE scores are not a general requirement but may be relevant for specific postgraduate programs.
Acceptance rate (%): The acceptance rate is difficult to determine for all programs but is highly competitive, especially for popular fields. Admission to the medical program is very selective.
Cost per year for interational students: The cost depends on the program. Many Greek-taught programs are tuition-free for all students. However, the English-taught Medical Degree program has a tuition fee of ~$14,040 USD (€13,000 EUR) per year.
Cost per year for local students: EU students also pay no tuition fees for the majority of Greek-taught programs. For the English-taught Medical Degree program, the tuition fee is the same: ~$14,040 USD (€13,000 EUR) per year.
Scholarship (yes/no): Yes, but limited and highly competitive.

Minimum IELTS score (or average):
Standard Level: A minimum of IELTS Academic 7.0 overall, with at least 6.5 in each component.
Higher Level: A minimum of IELTS Academic 7.5 overall, with at least 7.0 in each component.
Minimum GPA (or average): A specific GPA is not the primary requirement. Instead, Oxford has very high expectations for academic achievement in national qualifications. For example, for an applicant from the USA, a very high GPA is expected alongside scores of 38-40 points on the International Baccalaureate (IB) or AAA grades in A-levels.
Minimum SAT score (or average): SAT/ACT are not generally required for undergraduate admission, though they may be used as supporting evidence. GMAT/GRE are often required for specific graduate programs. For example, some graduate programs require a GMAT score of 740 or a GRE of 324.
Cost per year for interational students: Tuition fees are program-specific and can range widely. In addition to tuition, students must pay a separate "College fee" of around $12,000 USD per year. Humanities: ~$40,000 USD. Science/Engineering: ~$50,000 USD. Medicine: ~$62,000 USD. Living costs are estimated at $16,400 - $23,500 USD per year.
Cost per year for local students: The standard undergraduate tuition fee is ~$12,200 USD (£9,535). Living costs are estimated at $16,400 - $23,500 USD per year.
Scholarship (yes/no): Yes, a wide range of scholarships is available.

Minimum IELTS score (or average): The standard minimum requirement is an IELTS Academic 7.5 overall, with no element lower than 7.0. For some programs, the requirement may be slightly lower.
Minimum GPA (or average): A specific GPA is not the primary requirement. Cambridge requires exceptional academic performance in national qualifications. For example, for an applicant from the USA, a very high GPA is expected alongside scores of 38-40 points on the International Baccalaureate (IB) or A*AA grades in A-levels.
Minimum SAT score (or average): SAT/ACT are not generally required for undergraduate admission. GMAT/GRE are often required for specific graduate programs. For example, some graduate programs require a GMAT score in the range of 625-635.
Cost per year for interational students: Tuition fees are program-specific and can range widely. In addition to tuition, students must pay a separate "College fee" of around $12,800 USD per year. Arts/Humanities: ~$34,600 USD. Science/Engineering: ~$52,600 USD. Medicine: ~$90,300 USD. Living costs are estimated at $15,600 - $21,100 USD per year.
Cost per year for local students: The standard undergraduate tuition fee is ~$12,200 USD (£9,535). Living costs are estimated at $15,600 - $21,100 USD per year.
Scholarship (yes/no): Yes, a wide range of scholarships is available.

Minimum IELTS score (or average): Standard Level: IELTS Academic 6.5 overall, with 6.0 in each component. Good Level: IELTS Academic 7.0 overall, with 6.5 in each component. Advanced Level: IELTS Academic 7.5 overall, with 7.0 in each component.
Minimum GPA (or average): A specific GPA is not the only factor, but high academic achievement is essential. For US applicants, a very high GPA is expected. For an undergraduate degree, a 3.3/4.0 or higher is a common reference, but many programs require a GPA equivalent to a UK first-class degree.
Minimum SAT score (or average): SAT/ACT are not generally required but can be used as supplementary evidence. For some undergraduate programs, a SAT score of 1440 or a composite ACT score of 32 may be considered. GMAT/GRE are often required for specific graduate programs.
Acceptance rate (%): 14.2%. The acceptance rate for postgraduate programs is around 38%.
Cost per year for interational students: Tuition fees vary significantly by program, from approximately ~$38,000 USD for Arts & Humanities programs to ~$68,000 USD for Medicine. The estimated living costs in London are around $16,500 - $27,000 USD per year.
Cost per year for local students: The standard undergraduate tuition fee is ~$12,200 USD (£9,535).
National ranking: Consistently ranked among the top 10 universities in the UK.
Scholarship (yes/no): Yes, a wide range of scholarships is available.

Minimum IELTS score (or average): Standard Level: IELTS Academic 6.5 overall, with 6.0 in each component. Higher Level: IELTS Academic 7.0 overall, with 6.5 in each component.
Minimum GPA (or average): A specific GPA is not the primary requirement. Imperial requires exceptional academic performance in national qualifications. For US applicants, a very high GPA is expected alongside an International Baccalaureate (IB) score of 40-41 points or AAA - A*AAA grades in A-levels.
Minimum SAT score (or average): SAT/ACT are not generally required. Admission is based on academic qualifications and, for some programs, an admissions test. GMAT/GRE are often required for specific graduate programs, particularly at the Imperial College Business School.
Cost per year for interational students: Tuition fees are program-specific and can range widely. A common range for engineering is ~$52,400 USD per year, while medicine can be up to ~$68,700 USD per year. Estimated living costs in London are around $19,800 - $21,100 USD per year.
Cost per year for local students: The standard undergraduate tuition fee is ~$12,200 USD (£9,535).
Scholarship (yes/no): Yes, a wide range of scholarships is available.

University Name: London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE)
Minimum IELTS score (or average): Undergraduate: IELTS Academic 7.0 overall, with 7.0 in each component. Graduate: IELTS Academic 7.0 overall, with a minimum of 6.5 in each component, though some programs require higher.
Minimum GPA (or average): A specific GPA is not the primary requirement. LSE requires exceptional academic performance in national qualifications. For US applicants, a very high GPA is expected alongside scores of 38-40 on the International Baccalaureate (IB) or AAA grades in A-levels. Some sources suggest a GPA of 3.3 on a 4.0 scale or higher.
Minimum SAT score (or average): SAT/ACT are not generally required but can be used as supplementary evidence. GMAT/GRE are often required for specific graduate programs. For example, some graduate programs require a GMAT score of 680 or higher.
Cost per year for interational students: The undergraduate tuition fee is approximately ~$42,400 USD (£33,164) per year. For postgraduate students, fees range from ~$44,700 USD (£34,920) to ~$54,300 USD (£42,480) per year. Estimated living costs in London are around $16,500 - $27,000 USD per year.
Cost per year for local students: The standard undergraduate tuition fee is ~$12,200 USD (£9,535).
Scholarship (yes/no): Yes, a wide range of scholarships is available.
